data.title: 10 of the best places to buy online glasses
data.meta_description: When buying glasses online, people can choose from prescription and nonprescription options. There are also other factors to consider. Learn more here.
data.text:
Several retailers offer prescription glasses online. Some brands include:

Best for fast delivery turnaround: Overnight Glasses

Price: starting from $40

Shipping: overnight or 3-day shipping

Returns: 7-day return policy

Overnight Glasses offers a wide range of prescription glasses from major retailers and claims to deliver within 24 hours.

The company has accreditation from the BBB, has a B+ rating, and is also favorable among customers with a 4.77-star review rating.

Pros and cons

The company offers a large supply of glasses for adults and children and allows customers to use flexible spending accounts (FSA) and HSA plans to pay for their prescriptions.

Overnight Glasses also offers lens replacement for any pair of glasses that a person already owns from any retailer.

However, customers who left negative reviews on the BBB report that they had difficulty receiving refunds and getting into contact with customer service.

Learn more about Overnight Glasses.

Best for athletes: ROKA Eyewear

Price: starting from $215

Shipping: 2–7 business days

Returns: 30-day returns policy

The idea for Roka Eyewear came from two American swimmers who wanted to market their eyewear for athletes requiring efficiency during sports.

The company offers a wide range of prescription glasses, sunglasses, and other athletic gear. Customers can try on up to four pairs of glasses at a time for a 7-day trial period.

It is important to note that the company does have limited prescription ranges for each pair of glasses on its site.

While Roka does not have accreditation with the BBB, it does have an A+ rating on the site.

Pros and cons

It also accepts some major insurance providers, free shipping for orders above $150, 30-day free returns, and a 2-year warranty period.

However, the warranty does not cover normal wear and tear, including lens scratches and surface abrasions. It also does not cover incidental damage.

Learn more about ROKA Eyewear.

Best place to buy glasses and contacts together: Warby Parker

Price: starting from $95 for glasses

Shipping: 7–10 business days

Returns: 30-day returns policy

Warby Parker offers a selection of glasses, sunglasses, and contact lenses. The company is not BBB-accredited, but the brand has an A+ rating on the review platform.

Pros and cons

The company offers at-home trial services, where a person can request free delivery of up to five pairs of glasses for a 5-day trial period.

Warby Parker also offers customers the option to complete an eye exam if they live near one of the company’s stores.

The brand accepts some major insurance providers and offers a 6-month no-scratch guarantee.

However, those who left negative reviews on the BBB state that the customer service is inconsistent and that they experienced delivery delays.

Learn more about Warby Parker.

Best for prescription sunglasses: Liingo Eyewear

Price: starting from $49

Shipping: around 2 weeks

Returns: 60-day returns policy

Liingo Eyewear offers a large selection of glasses, sunglasses, and accessories. The company sells prescription lenses ranging from -14.00 to +6.00 sphere and cylinder ranges between -3.75 and 3.75.

Reviews on its website are mostly positive, and the company has an A+ rating with the BBB.

Pros and cons

Liingo Eyewear offers a virtual try-on option, free in-home trials, an option to assist in finding the right frame for customers, and an in-app prescription reader that can scan a person’s glasses to find their prescription.

Liingo offers free shipping and 60-day returns, and frame adjustment reimbursements.

However, it does not provide any long-term warranties.

Learn more about Liingo Eyewear.

Best for name-brand eyewear: EyeBuyDirect

Price: starting from $9

Shipping: 2–day shipping

Returns: 14-day returns policy

EyeBuyDirect offers several custom pairs of glasses and sunglasses. In addition to its own brand of products, the company also provides some brand-name options.

EyeBuyDirect has an A+ rating with the BBB and generally receives positive reviews on its website.

Pros and cons

The company offers services, such as a glasses search guide, a guide to reading prescriptions, and an eye doctor finder to help customers find doctors to obtain a prescription. Additionally, it offers virtual try-on and a 1-year guarantee on all glasses.

However, the company’s thinner lenses are more expensive, potentially costing over $100.

Learn more about EyeBuyDirect.

Best for multifocal lenses: GlassesUSA

Price: starting from $78

Shipping: 7–10 days

Returns: 14-day returns policy.

GlassesUSA offers a selection of brand-name glasses and sunglasses from various manufacturers.

The company sells single and multifocal lenses and also offers services, such as a virtual try-on and an in-app scanner to read a person’s subscription in their current glasses.

GlassesUSA has a B rating with the BBB, but does not have accreditation with the platform. It also has a 2.12 out of 5-star rating. The company closed over 1000 complaints in the past 3 years.

Pros and cons

It also offers free shipping and returns, a 1-year warranty, and the ability to pay via FSA and HSA cards. The brand also supports paying via insurance providers.

Negative reviews on the BBB report that customer service is slow to respond. Others mention receiving wrong prescriptions and experiencing shipping delays.

Learn more about GlassesUSA.

Best for a budget: Payne Glasses

Price: starting from $5.95

Shipping: up to 3 weeks

Returns: 30-day returns policy

Payne Glasses offer several styles of frames and glasses for adults and children.

The company sells multifocal, progressive, single lens, blue light, and high-index lenses. It also provides a large variety of colors, materials, and shapes, including nautical, steampunk, and helmet frames.

The company has an A+ rating and receives an average rating of 4.73 out of 5 stars on the BBB website.

Pros and cons

Payne features guides that teach customers how to read their prescription and pupillary distance.

Unlike other competitors, Payne does not provide free shipping. The standard package offers a conditional 30-day return policy that excludes shipping costs. Alternatively, people can upgrade to a risk-free warranty package that offers up to two exchanges within 30 days and one exchange within 6 months of delivery.

Best for a versatile style inventory: Zenni Optical

Price: starting from $6.95

Shipping: 7–14 business days

Returns: 30-day returns policy

Zenni Optical offers both designer frames and its own brand of frames.

It also sells Blokz lenses, blue light lenses that help protect the eyes from digital screens. Many lenses include options and upgrades, such as UV protection, anti-scratch coating,

It has an A+ rating and an average of 2.79 out of 5 stars rating from customer reviews on the BBB site. Negative reviews mention incorrect prescriptions and delivery delays.

Pros and cons

Zenni Optical has a virtual try-on service and provides guidance on measuring pupillary distance. The company also accepts FSA and HSA payments.

However, the company does not offer free shipping.

Learn more about Zenni Optical.

Best for lens options: Lensabl

Price: starting from $97

Shipping: 4–7 business days

Returns: 30-day returns policy

Lensabl offers prescription glasses and contacts, frames, and lens replacements. People can choose from in-house and brand glasses and sunglasses.

Customers give this company a 2.97 out of 5 stars rating on the BBB.

Pros and cons

Many lens types and options are available, including blue-light blocking, anti-reflective coating, anti-scratch coating, and UV protection.

However, some reviewers on the BBB state they received incomplete or incorrect orders and experienced delivery delays.

Learn more about Lensabl.

Best for brand-name glasses: Eyeglasses.com

Price: starting from $108

Shipping: up to 7 days

Returns: 30-day returns policy

Eyeglasses.com has a selection of glasses from around 350 brands, including Armani, Prada, Polo, and Ray-Ban. On the website, people have many filter options to choose from, including shape, bridge, temple, and material.

Moreover, people can choose from prescription eyeglasses, reading glasses, and prescription and nonprescription sunglasses.

Eyeglasses.com does not hold accreditation with the BBB. The organization gives it an A rating.

Pros and cons

Eyeglasses.com offers bifocal, trifocal, progressive, and blue-light-blockers lenses. It also accepts insurance.

However, warranty periods depend on which brand a person chooses. People may wish to carefully consider the different warranties before choosing a particular frame.
